biogHist.abstract: Orana Family Services was established in Coolaroo in 1988. It was formerly based in Burwood and was known as Orana, the Peace Memorial Homes for Children. From 1988, services were transferred to Coolaroo. In 1990, two family group homes and two specialist houses moved from Burwood to Coolaroo.
biogHist.p: Orana Family Services was established in Melbourne's outer north-west in 1988. It was formerly based in Burwood and was known as Orana, the Peace Memorial Homes for Children. The name change reflected the extension of Orana into providing non-residential and family services, such as counselling and educational support, plus the organisation's relocation to Coolaroo.

The transition to Coolaroo began in 1988 and residential services moved two years later. In 1990, two family group homes and two specialist houses moved from Burwood to Coolaroo. One of the specialist houses operated as a Primary Age service for six children. These children had attended schools with specialised services in Burwood and the move meant they had to adjust to mainstream schooling.

Orana Family Services continued to run a family group home in Waverley and a respite service, Gwenalan, until 1992. On 30 June 2011, Orana Family Services ceased being a provider of residential care. The remaining homes and children in its programme were transferred to Wesley Mission.

chronItem.event: Location - Orana Family Services was located in Papworth Crescent, Meadow Heights

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Orana, the Peace Memorial Homes for Children (1953 - 1988)

descriptiveNote.p: Orana Family Services was a Linkage Partner to the Who Am I? Project.
Orana Family Services changed its name to Orana UnitingCare in 2011 when the organisation ceased being a provider of residential care.
